availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Washington Pitt (Nelson County, Kentucky, resident (carpenter))

body.p: Nelson County, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Son of Felix N. Pitt and Ellen Pitt. Resident in Nelson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned four enslaved persons in Nelson County in 1850. Student in Nelson County, Kentucky, in 1860. Household owned four enslaved persons in Nelson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 288A-B.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 258.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 125B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 10, p. 139A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Nelson County Marriages, 1868-1891, Film #000500450, p. 656 of 727 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
